p: The Mexican population has a high prevalence of chronic diseases and obesity, placing the population at a particular risk for severe COVID-19. For 2018 up to 18.4% of adults reported hypertension and 10.3% diabetes. With respect to risk factors, 36.1% of the adult population is obese, while 11.4% smokes ( 10, 11). The identification of predictive factors for severe COVID-19 is useful to optimize hospital resources and to strengthen policies towards chronic disease prevention and control.
